我。

我确信《哈利·波特与理性之道》教会了我一些它所要教的显而易见的事情。然而，在我第一次读到这本书十年后回想起来，最让我印象深刻的往往是故事情节中间的简短、随意的片段。

弗雷德和乔治忧心忡忡地交换了眼色。

“我想不出任何办法，”乔治说。

“我也不能，”弗雷德说。 “对不起。”

哈利盯着他们。

然后哈利开始解释你是如何思考事情的。

哈利说，众所周知，这需要超过两秒钟的时间。

-《哈利·波特与理性方法》，第 25 章。

这是LessWrong式理性的第一堂课，实际上，由于我接触了HPMoR和序列，我开始尝试刻意自学。这实际上是“按时钟思考”的强大技巧。

我曾经将其称为“思考五分钟”，但这个技术名称用词不当。这实际上是对孩子的谎言。有时我思考的时间要少得多，大约三十秒。有时我会思考更多的时间，比如几天。尽管如此，当你第一次学习武术时，你可能会以一种尴尬、僵硬的姿势站立，不能转身或迈步，所以我首先学会了以五分钟为增量按时钟思考。

二.

当我第一次去健身房举重时，我和一个朋友一起做的。我认为这不会很好地发挥作用（我是一个很瘦的人），但我想取悦他们。我在他们指给我的长凳上坐下，紧紧抓住他们要我抓住的重物，把它上下举了一会儿。当他们说停止时，我就停止了。 “这似乎有点快，”我记得当时说道，“我们完成了吗？”亲爱的读者，我们还没有完成。当我第一次开始和另一个朋友慢跑时，这种模式又重复了。我不知何故期望整个跑步过程会持续下去，你知道，直到我们感到无聊，这很快就发生了。

（如果我可以说一句话来为年轻的我辩护的话，他真的没有听起来那么不健康。足球很有趣，我经常踢球。堆放干草堆给了我报酬，我很愿意只要有人告诉我，我就可以拿钱搬重物。）

因此，当我第一次遇到一项既不有趣也不立即有利可图的艰巨智力任务时，我可能会感到惊讶，我有点退缩了。根据记忆，那可能是微积分。我讨厌微积分。我会坐在桌旁做作业或为考试而学习，然后发现自己读了几遍问题，然后瞥了一眼时钟或渴望地看着电路理论教科书。 （我对“娱乐”的定义让很多人感到惊讶。）然而，当助教问起时，我会说我学了几个小时的微积分。我坐在桌子旁，不是吗？

就像坐在干草棚[1]的谷仓凳子上一样，无论你做了多久，都完全无法将草捆堆放好，坐在办公桌前盯着时钟也完全无法让衍生品的想法进入我的脑海。

三．

但你知道，这并不完全是上面引文中弗雷德和乔治遇到的问题，不是吗？他们大概在那两秒钟里正在思考。那么让我来谈谈文化人类学的一些巧妙的知识。

当两个人说话时，一个人说完和另一个人接电话之间会存在一段间隙。由于他们事先都不知道什么时候能说完，而且句号实际上也不会发音，所以听者必须等待一小会儿才能开始说话。如果听者等待的时间不够长，他们就会打断对方并与对方交谈。如果听者等待太久，你可能会陷入尴尬的沉默。

我以前真的不知道要等多久。有人告诉我，当我还是个孩子的时候，有人问我怎么样，然后必须等待半分钟（整整三十秒！）或更长时间才能开始说话，这并不罕见。当我说话时，我所说的话会是经过深思熟虑的、出人意料的。我认为发生的事情是，我不知道你应该在来回的谈话中快速做出回应。

我必须学会这一点，刻意强迫自己加快语速。有一段时间，我充分利用了不置可否的开场白，例如“你知道，我正在考虑这个问题……”，这让我获得了额外的宝贵时间来弄清楚接下来我想说的话。最终，尽管我的技巧得到了不错的提高，但现在我发现这种沉默和大多数人一样尴尬。对我来说，通常很容易根据对话的语气来匹配一个浅薄的、足够准确的评论，然后直接说出来。如果我这样做，那么谈话通常会顺利进行。耶，成功了！

然后，在一些有趣的哈利·波特同人小说中的这种简单的交流让我意识到，如果我在谈话中，我已经学会在一秒钟左右后切断我的想法，这有时会让我说出非常愚蠢的事情。一旦你意识到这一点，有时你可以通过设置稍微太快的谈话节奏并温和地引导他们停止思考，让人们自己说蠢话。

我有说过这是你可以对其他人做的事情吗？好吧，你猜怎么着——人们也可以这样对你。

也许我使用“按时钟思考”技巧的最戏剧性的场合是在工作面试期间。这是一次与多个不同人的多轮面试，此时我正在与人力资源部门交谈。我们进行了很好的交谈，讨论了我对办公室布局的看法，我对什么样的工作感到兴奋，然后他们问我，没有任何迹象表明这是一个不同类型的问题，我想要什么样的薪水。

读者，我可以看到明显的、足够准确的回应，这将使这场友好的对话继续下去。在到达面试之前我已经对此进行了一些思考，我可以快速取出缓存的号码，然后我们就可以继续交谈。我正要这么做。我已经练习了足够多的保持对话流畅的技巧。不过幸运的是，我还练习了注意到一个我不应该轻率地继续过去的重要问题的技巧。我并没有完全停止谈话，但我确实说了一个变体，“这是一个重要的问题，如果我们认为我们很合适，那么我不认为这会成为障碍。让我仔细考虑一下，我“会回复你吗？我很好奇你的想法是什么。” [2] [3]他们退缩了一点，我确实停止了谈话三十秒来真正思考我的答案。

在一个普通人的生活中，有很多时候，你会在谈话中被问到一个需要你思考的问题。对话流程的规范建议您最多思考几秒钟。当谈论天气或孩子们的表现时，这些规范很可爱，并且它们与如何最好地实现长期项目或如何解决难题的问题相反。

我在工作会议中使用了按时钟思考。 （Adam：“我们如何将此功能添加到 UI 中？” Bella：“作为侧边栏怎么样？” Adam：“太好了，听起来不错。” 我：“我有一个想法。让我们每个人都考虑一下花两分钟写下我们的想法，然后我们分享这些想法？”）

我在与女朋友的讨论中使用了“按时钟思考”。 （不，我不是在这里给你一个例子。如果你很好奇我的浪漫生活是如何运作的，我是多面体，请随时约我约会。）

实际上，你并不需要对话间隙的社会压力来使这成为一种有用的技术。这就是我看到人们最常犯这个错误的地方。不过，由于选择偏差，显然我没有看到其他人在独处时会犯那么多错误。

练习的技巧是发现你只是试图快速思考，并检查这是否是你想要更多考虑的决定。你想要训练的技巧是那一刻的注意，小小的警钟告诉你应该给出你的答复，否则当那个警钟充满谎言时，这将是一个尴尬的沉默。如果这是理性武术中型的一个动作，那么该动作将从提出一个问题开始，让你张开嘴快速给出答案，然后再抓住自己并花时间真正按时钟思考。

从五分钟开始。训练自己如何利用时间。然后练习较小的增量。不要让自己偷懒或分心。

四．

所有这些都是因为思考太快而需要放慢速度。那另一个方向呢？

有时我听到有人说他们已经思考一个难题数周、数月甚至数年。有时候那个人就是我！有人多年来一直在思考这个问题，而且好的想法正在发生，这可能都是事实，但我经常对此表示怀疑。

当我十三岁左右的时候，我妈妈给了我一把便宜的吉他作为节日礼物。我发现这个乐器很有趣，我尝试着玩它，看看它能发出什么声音。我当然听过吉他音乐，但我的家人或直接圈子里没有人演奏。在接下来的十五年里，我一直带着吉他，把它从衣柜里、宿舍床下或汽车后备箱里拿出来，摸索着调音，拨动几根琴弦，查找一两个和弦。 ，并享受它充满房间的声音。

你可以说我弹了很多年吉他，这确实是事实，但它会极具误导性。在最初的十年里，如果我有一百多个小时把吉他放在腿上，我会感到惊讶，而其中只有十几个小时是在教练或老师指导我该怎么做的情况下进行的。去年，我决定真正能够用吉他演奏一些音乐，上个月我花在积极练习上的时间可能比我拥有它的第二年花在触摸乐器上的时间还要多。

在我读到《HPMoR》中的这些台词之前，我经常会思考一些事情很多年，也就是说，我会把这个想法从后柜里拿出来，仔细思考一下，然后再收起来。有时我仍然会使用这样的语言，但现在当我真正想找到答案或用我的想法做一些事情时，我有了额外的版本。

想象一下这个问题，就像你正在练习吉他一样，你需要为下个月的世俗至日制作音乐。 [4]

如果你像我一样，这会让一些事情变得更加清晰。

心烦意乱的时候就别想这些了。采取某种方式记笔记或将信息带到下一次会议中。您需要清楚地了解“足够好”是什么样子，才能知道自己是否达到了目标。毫不留情地丢弃那些不会实现目标的路线，但也不要不断地用头撞在没有取得进展的同一堵砖墙上。当你盯着令人着迷的电路理论教科书时，不要对自己说你正在研究它，其中充满了基尔霍夫定律和戴维宁定理（微积分最终迫使我进行适当的战斗）等秘密，只是在等待你流浪。

这就是我在三十多岁时做出疯狂职业转变的想法。这是我在决定是否离开我的家乡搬到大城市时使用的方法。我选择了几个周末，尽可能让这些周末不受干扰，并使用秒表积极地工作整整两天。我期望能够取得真正的进展，即使这种进展是以排除某些事情或消除死胡同的形式出现的，而且我一直在努力。

从五分钟开始。训练自己如何利用时间。然后练习更大的增量。留出时间休息和维持生活，但不要将做饭与专注于问题混为一谈。

五、

《按时钟思考》是最明显的心理动作之一，我可以明确地将其归因于尤德科夫斯基的写作。我希望我能向自己描述年轻时如何做到这一点，因为我会从这项技术中受益。由于缺乏时间旅行，我能做的下一个最好的事情就是用比尤德科斯基使用的更多的文字来解释它，以防有人仅仅通过阅读哈利和韦斯莱之间的对话就无法吸收核心思想并生成训练其反应的步骤双胞胎。写下通往罗马的一千条路，也许当所有其他路都失败时，其中一条会引导某人到达那里。

我认为这是最困难的部分。不是仅仅吸收这个想法，不是意识到它的重要性，而是练习这个动作，直到你在顶着社会压力或在思考其他事情时做到了为止。我最好、最喜欢的老师曾经给我讲过一个故事，他早上检查邮箱时在冰上滑倒，然后发现自己完美地向后摔倒。我相信，这就是正确的理性武术所要达到的根深蒂固的使用水平。

能够按时钟思考，即使在早上喝完咖啡之前感到惊讶。这就是我所渴望的。 Ars Longa——艺术是漫长的！ Tsuyoku Naritai – 我想变得更强！

哈利说，你永远不会认为任何问题都是不可能的，直到你拿起一个真正的时钟，通过分针的运动思考它五分钟。不是比喻意义上的五分钟，而是物理时钟上的五分钟。

-HPMoR，第 25 章

讨论; https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/tbJdxJMAiehewGpq2/impressions-from-base-gpt-4 tbJdxJMAiehewGpq2mishka Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:43:23 GMT Quantopian contest, but for food intake and weightPublished on November 8, 2023 5:41 AM GMT

十二年前，我每天摄入约 1200 卡路里热量，体重减轻了约 100 磅。残酷地令人不快和分解代谢，但大多是成功的。它正在悄悄回来。没有像糖水、快餐、外出就餐这样容易实现的目标。

从那时起，我记录了每天吃的每一口食物，无论是周末禁食时喝的 10 卡路里肉汤，还是暴饮暴食我最喜欢的深盘“lucent”披萨4000 卡路里，一切都使用食物秤，而不是一次不假思索地将油倒入其中。食谱或盲目地将花生酱涂在三明治上。这培养了超人的卡路里估算能力。 “你说这个是280大卡？尝起来有350大卡，我看一下菜谱……原来如此，食品标签上的酥油少了一半。”我经常称重，拥有阻抗身体成分数据、来自间接热量计（我现在拥有的）的定期 RMR 数据、睡眠-觉醒时间、所有健身课程和每日步数。

直到去年，我还认为 CICO 是原因而不是结果。不管出于什么原因，我更饿了，或者意志力更弱，所以我必须忍受痛苦才能达到健康的体重。从那以后，我的信念转向了一个由未知的稳态控制的蜿蜒设定点。无论是污染、欧米伽比率、重力调节器还是某种组合，我都非常想弄清楚。

理想情况下，庞大的纵向数据集包含数十或数百个重叠的微观实验（数月的生酮、周末禁食、低蛋白、土豆、一波又一波的单调膳食），这些实验加起来超过了在实验室测试单个假设数周的统计显着性。如果肥胖问题的答案需要复杂的重叠或条件序列，那么它可能隐藏在数据挖掘中并首先通过数据挖掘发现，而不是由聪明的假设者发明整套。您将很难找到更多或更好的数据来挖掘。

我今年 41 岁，基本上已经退休，没有处方药或真正的健康问题，没有压力源，甚至没有重大的起伏。我有预算和时间来准备符合任何规格的食物，但不能（出于恶心/厌恶）食用动物（35 岁）或鸡蛋（~5 岁）。乳制品我仍然可以接受，所以不要发送任何工厂化农场视频并毁掉它们。除非它是具有明显优势的基本补充剂，可以替代牛磺酸或镁等缺失的（动物）营养素，否则我不太喜欢补充剂。

回想起Quantopian 编写最佳股市预测算法竞赛的乐趣，我想提供相同的内容，只是包含摄入量和体重数据。我建立了一个简单的拟合来使用摄入量和体重来预测 RMR 。随着时间的推移，它会发生显着的变化，或者使用蛋白质杠杆来最大限度地减少总摄入量，减肥将是一个微不足道的练习。看起来更像是我的设定点只有在满足某些条件时才会向上或向下移动，并且我想找到正在工作的控制系统。举个例子，纯粹是出于奇思妙想：

 RMR_rolling = 2500 RMR_today = RMR_rolling if (trailing_average(omega-6:3, 30 days) >; 10:1) { if (yesterday_protein >; 50g) RMR_today = RMR_rolling - 500 } else RMR_today += min(max(intake - RMR_rolling, 0), 500) if (steps_today * weight_current >; 1,000,000 ft-lbs) set_point -= 0.1 lbs

如果这么简单，也许我可以构建或外包它，但我正在寻找一位有兴趣和创造力的统计学家来设计我无法想象的控制系统。

@disturbance in aa recent LW post that got lots of comments:

Statement: I want to deliberately balance the caution and the recklessness in developing AGI, such that it gets created in the last possible moment so that I and my close ones do not die.


A seemingly straightforward implication of this view is that we should therefore be willing to take on some amount of risk in order to build towards AGI faster than we would in a world where we had the luxury to take our time.

I think some of these sentiments and their implications are based on a mistaken view of the relative difficulty of particular technical and social challenges, but here I want to focus on a totally different point: there are lots of ways that things could go well without AGI (at least for a while).

Even if positive scenarios without AGI are unlikely or unrealistic given our current circumstances and trajectory, it's useful to have a concrete vision of what a good medium-term future without AGI could look like. I think it's especially important to take a moment to reflect on these possible good futures because recent preliminary governance wins, even if they succeed without qualification, are mainly focused on restriction and avoidance of bad outcomes rather than on building towards particular positive outcomes.

The rest of this post is a collection of examples of technologies, ideas, projects, and trends unrelated to AGI that give me hope and joy when I see them being worked on or talked about. It's not meant to be exhaustive in any sense - mostly it is just a list of areas that I personally enjoy reading about, and would consider professional opportunities related to them.

Most of them involve solving hard technological and social problems. Some are quite speculative, and likely to be intractable or extremely unlikely to come to pass in isolation. But making incremental progress on any one is probably robustly positive for the world and lucrative and fulfilling for the people working on them [1] . And progress tends to snowball, as long as there's no catastrophe to stop it.

As you read through the list, try to set aside your own views and probabilities on AGI, other x-risks, and fizzle or stagnation scenarios. Imagine a world where it is simply a given that humanity has time and space to flourish unimpeded for a time. Visualize what such a world might look like, where solutions are permitted to snowball without the threat of everything being cut short or falling to pieces. The purpose of this post is not to argue that any such world is particularly likely to be actualized; it is intended to serve as a concrete reminder that there are things worth working towards, and concrete ways to do so.

Energy abundance; solar and nuclear energy

Energy abundance has the potential to revolutionize many aspects of civilization, and there are fewer and fewer technological barriers holding it back. Regulatory barriers (eg to nuclear power, and to all kinds of construction and growth generally) may remain, but in a hypothetical world free of unrelated obstacles, energy abundance is looking more and more like a case of "when" and "how," rather than "if".

Prediction markets

Robin Hanson has been talking about the benefits of prediction markets since 1988, but it feels like with the recent growth of Manifold and the continued operation of real-money prediction markets (PredictIt, Kalshi, Polymarket) things are starting to snowball.

I'm most excited about the future of real-money policy prediction markets on all sorts of legal and governance issues. The possibility of such markets might seem distant given the current regulatory climate around prediction markets themselves, but that seems like the kind of thing that could change rapidly under the right circumstances. Imagine if, instead of a years-long slog through the FDA, the process for getting a new drug approved was a matter of simply convincing a prediction market that the efficacy and harms met certain objective risk thresholds, with private insurers competing to backstop the liability.

Georgism and land value taxes are an elegant idea for aligning incentives, funding public goods, and combating rent-seeking. I think land value taxes are simple enough that there is some hope of incremental adoption in some form or jurisdiction in the relatively near future. A decent introduction and source for further reading is this winner from Scott's book review contest a couple of years ago.

Balsa Research

Zvi's thing , focused on addressing low-hanging fruit and finding achievable, shovel-ready wins through public policy. Whether Balsa in particular succeeds at its mission or not, I think it is an exciting model for how rationalists can enter the space of public policy-making and politics in an effective and robustly positive way.

dath ilan

dath ilan is Eliezer's fictional medianworld. The defining characteristic is that the real Eliezer's most important personality traits are the median among the entire planet's population. Because Eliezer himself is unusually smart, kind, and honorable compared to the average earthling, the population of dath ilan is much smarter, kinder, and better coordinated as a whole compared to Earth.

Many details and features of dath ilan would probably look pretty strange to an average earthling. Some of this strangeness is due to Eliezer's other unusual-for-Earth traits and personal preferences, but the deeper lesson of dath ilan is that many of their systems of governance, coordination mechanisms, methods of doing science , and modes of thought are actually derived from a combination of reasoning from first principles and relatively few assumptions about human nature and behavior.

It's not that there's a particular "dath ilani" way of aggregating information or resolving conflicts or running an economy. Rather, the desire to flourish, cooperate, build, and enjoy the benefits of technological civilization and other nice things is common among a very wide distribution of possible humans. It might take a certain baseline level of population-level intelligence, coordination ability, and lucky history to actually achieve all those nice things, but civilizations which do manage the feat will probably share some commonalities with each other and with dath ilan that Earth currently lacks.

dath ilan is currently getting along pretty well without AGI, making it an inspiring picture of what one possible future of Earth without AGI could look like. In worlds where Earth succeeds in the long-term, I expect that it will share many features with dath ilan. But I think a more interesting and exciting question involves thinking about ways that the best versions of Earth and dath ilan will still be different.

When I imagine a world that manages to solve problems or make significant progress in even a few of the areas above, I feel a lot more optimistic about the possibility of such a world confronting the challenge of building an AGI safely, eventually. And even if we still fail at that ultimate challenge, such a world would be a nicer place to live in the meantime.

If you're feeling despair about recent AI progress, consider turning some of your attention or professional efforts elsewhere. There are lots of opportunities in research, startups, and established companies that have nothing to do with pushing the frontier of AI capabilities [3] , and lots of ways to have fun, build meaning, and enjoy life that don't involve thinking about AGI at all.

A 2-month hybrid mentorship program for women looking to strengthen their research skills and network in technical AI safety research beginning in January 2024.

This includes 1-week in-person retreat in Oxford, UK followed by a 2-month remote mentorship by established researchers in the field, with networking and weekly research talks.

Athena aims to equip women with the knowledge, skills, and network they need to thrive in AI safety research. We believe that diversity is a strength, and hope to see this program as a stepping stone towards a more diverse and inclusive AI safety research field.

This program is designed to offer mentorship opportunities to technically qualified women who are early in their AI safety research careers or looking to transition into the field by connecting them with experienced mentors, resources to upskill, networking, and a supportive community.

Who should apply?

Women and people of other marginalized genders that have some research or technical industry experience, and are interested in transitioning to AI Alignment research or have a bit of experience in the Alignment field but are looking for more support. We encourage those with a non-traditional background to apply and welcome interdisciplinary work in this field.

Why are we doing this

The current culture requires a shift to retain a diverse set of qualified researchers

Athena aims to increase the number of women pursuing careers in AI alignment, which is currently a male-dominated field with a very specific culture that can initially come across as unwelcoming to those that aren't traditionally represented here. Women may have different hurdles to cross than their male counterparts such as implicit and explicit bias, different family and home obligations, unwanted approaches for romantic relationships by male colleagues, isolation, and a lack of representation.

We want to take steps to shift the current culture to one that values diversity and inclusivity through recruiting qualified women into the field through extended outreach, providing technical mentorship with an experienced researcher, creating a targeted support structure during the program, and continued role and grant placement support after the program. There are also opportunities for networking and collaboration within the larger research ecosystem.

Having diverse research teams and ideas is valuable for AI Alignment research

Research has consistently shown that diverse teams produce more innovative solutions. When we have a diverse group of people, including women, working on AI alignment, we are more likely to come up with comprehensive and holistic solutions that consider a wide range of perspectives and people. When more women participate in traditionally male-dominated fields like the sciences, the breadth of knowledge in that area usually grows, a surge in female involvement directly correlates with advancements in understanding [ 1 ]. Since there is a lack of women in this field, Athena aims to prepare women to join a research team or position after the program, where that team will benefit from this.

Research suggests that all-women programming can provide benefits to women

Cox & Fisher (2008) found that women in a single-sex environment in a software engineering course reported higher levels of enjoyment, fairness, motivation, support, and comfort and allowed them to perform at a level that exceeded that of the all-male groups in the class [ 1 ].

Kahveci (2008) explored a program for women in science, mathematics, and engineering and found that it helped marginalized women move towards legitimate participation in these fields and enhanced a sense of community and mutual engagement [ 2 ].

Creating more representation for future policy advisors and makers

As government awareness and sense of urgency grows for AI-related decision-making and legislation, we need a diverse range of experts in the field to help policy makers make informed decisions. If we only have a specific type of person in this position, the policies will reflect that, maybe to our detriment.
